snippet: The president said he would ask for changes to the E-rate program so that 99 percent of schools could upgrade to high-speed broadband and wireless service.
abstract: Pres Obama, visiting innovative North Carolina middle school, calls on Federal Communications Commission to expand E-rate program so that 99 percent of schools nationwide can upgrade to high-speed broadband and wireless service in five years.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and EDWARD WYATT
byline.contributor: Jackie Calmes reported from Mooresville, N.C., and Edward Wyatt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The president said he would ask for changes to the E-rate program so that 99 percent of schools could upgrade to high-speed broadband and wireless service.

headline.seo: Obama Promises Internet Upgrade for U.S. Schools
headline.main: Obama Promises to Have High-Speed Internet in Most Schools in 5 Years
headline.print_headline: Obama Promises to Have High-Speed Internet in Most Schools in 5 Years
